data.title: Crypto Mnemonic Pin
data.solution:
import sys
n = int(input())
w = input().split()
res = ""
for x in w:
    res += str(ord(x[0].lower()) - 96)
print(res)
data.statement:
You are developing a secure wallet. To generate a quick access [[PIN]], you must process a mnemonic seed phrase consisting of [[N]] words. For each word in the phrase:

1. Extract the first letter.
2. Find its position in the alphabet (where {{a}} = 1, {{b}} = 2, ..., {{z}} = 26).
3. The final result is the concatenation of all these numerical positions.

Example: For the words bit eth, the output is 25 ({{b}} is 2, {{e}} is 5).

testCases.title: Test 1
testCases.testIn:
7
alpha bravo charlie delta echo fox golf

testCases.title: Test 5
testCases.testIn:

testCases.title: Validator 5

zero zoo air bank coin cake ace door desk zinc yoga xray wind vase up ten sun rain quick play

data.constraints:
1 <= [[N]] <= 26
1 <= length of each word in [[W]] <= 20
All words are in lowercase.
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loopline N W:word(20)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of words.
<<Line 2:>> [[N]] space-separated strings [[W]] representing the seed phrase.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> A single string representing the concatenated [[PIN]].

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are developing a secure wallet. To generate a quick access PIN, you must process a mnemonic seed phrase consisting of N words. For each word in the phrase:

1. Extract the first letter.
2. Find its position in the alphabet (where a = 1, b = 2, ..., z = 26).
3. The final result is the concatenation of all these numerical positions.

Example: For the words bit eth, the output is 25 (b is 2, e is 5).
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of words.
Line 2: N space-separated strings W representing the seed phrase.
Output
Line 1: A single string representing the concatenated PIN.
Constraints
1 <= N <= 26
1 <= length of each word in W <= 20
All words are in lowercase.
Example
Input
7
alpha bravo charlie delta echo fox golf
Output
1234567
